radiographic_examinations.findings: The appendix appears inflamed, with significant mucosal enhancement and increased in caliber at its base measuring 10 mm. There is some stranding surrounding the base of the cecum and appendix as well as a small amount of supra-apendicular fluid. The lung bases are clear and the visualized heart and pericardium are unremarkable. The liver enhances homogeneously, without focal lesions. The gallbladder is unremarkable. The kidneys show symmetric nephrograms and excretion of contrast. The small and large bowel are within normal limits. No intra-abdominal free air or localized fluid collection. No lymphadenopathy or abdominal wall hernia.
